wiki.summary: Horan returns with “Slow Hands” as the second single from his debut record "Flicker." On “Slow Hands”, Niall drifts away from the more acoustic sound of his debut solo single “This Town.” He shows his edgier and sexier side in this classic rock-inspired tune following a man trying to be taken home by a forward female dance partner after a night out on the town. Horan said in an interview with SiriusXM that this song was made in homage to his influences growing up listening to the classic rock of the ‘70s and '80s. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: Horan returns with “Slow Hands” as the second single from his debut record "Flicker." On “Slow Hands”, Niall drifts away from the more acoustic sound of his debut solo single “This Town.” He shows his edgier and sexier side in this classic rock-inspired tune following a man trying to be taken home by a forward female dance partner after a night out on the town. Horan said in an interview with SiriusXM that this song was made in homage to his influences growing up listening to the classic rock of the ‘70s and '80s. The song was one of the last to be written for his upcoming album because as Niall put it: " I just thought, ‘You know what? I’m missing a bit of grit. Something a bit more funky, something with a bit heavier bass. " The track is produced by Julian Bunetta, a good friend of Niall’s and one of One Direction’s primary co-songwriters and producers. “Slow Hands” has been certified Gold in the UK and 3x Platinum in the US and in Ireland. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
